channel.title: How to make a TOS page on my forum?
channel.description:
I would like to know how to make a TOS page like MoparScape's one where you need to write "yes" or "no" in the bottom of the page. This page is when you arrive in the site for first time and you see this.
So, how can I make one ? Thanks and I'm using Invisionfree.

item.title: How to make a TOS page on my forum?

item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

cookies

item.title: How to make a TOS page on my forum?
item.dc:creator: @twins twins
item.description:
@twins wrote:

just have a body for that page and a accep/decline which directs to if accept continue else alert out of this page

and if you want to have “yes” as what you need to put just make it if(***==“yes”)
do blabla…

*** will be the var

item.title: How to make a TOS page on my forum?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“djdoyle1, post:13, topic:299738”]The thing is with the Mopars T & C’s
It doesnt include the FULL thing because its a PHP File
::
For u noobs: Its doesnt display the file that handles the Type Yes form

Maybe Moparisthebest should post the PHP File please?

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
        "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<title>www.moparisthebest.com TOS</title>
<style type="text/css">
body{font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;}
div{background: #E5E5E8; width: 70%; border: 1px solid black; font-family: verdana; font-size: 10pt;}
input{border: 1px solid black;}
</style>
</head>
<body bgcolor="#4682B4">
<center>
<div>
<b>www.moparisthebest.com Terms of Service</b>
</div>
<br />
<div style="text-align: left;">
<tt>
By typing <i>'yes'</i> you agree to everything stated below:<br /><br />

You are not an employee of Jagex LTD, runescape, or adlex solicitors,
and are not a family member or acquaintance of the aforementioned.<br /><br />

All of the information on this site is solely for learning purposes, as 
the main purpose of this site is to instruct people in the art of programming.
All programs provided for download from this site are entirely coded by the members
of this community and are not the intellectual property of any business or organization.
</tt>
</div>


<br />


<div style="text-align: left;">
<tt>
In order to use the forum you must agree to all of these rules as well:<br />
<ol>
<b><u>Primary Rules</u></b>
<li>If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all.</li><br />
<li>Use common sense.</li>
</ol> 
The staff reserves the right to interpret these primary rules any way we see fit, for example while posting child porn is not specifically against the rules, it should be common sense that it is not allowed.
<ol>
<b><u>Ideals</u></b>
<li>We are not anti-leech. If you respect our community and our ideas, feel free to ask questions and they will be kindly answered if you follow other rules. Answer to questions that others ask if you know the answer or remain silent!</li><br />
<li>We don't talk about things we don't know. This is an informative, not a misinformative community.</li><br />
<li>We respect each other and other communities. We don't flame each other or other communities. We don't fight on the forums.</li><br />
<li>We don't care about post count alone. If someone has high post count and most of it is spam, we hate them. If someone has high post count with informative posts, we love them. The higher count, the more we hate/love them.</li><br />
<li>We never ask for "rep".</li><br />

<b><u>Posts / Topics</u></b>
<li>We don't make spelling mistakes on purpose. We use "you" not "u", we use "why" not "y" etc.</li><br />
<li>We don't make posts that contain not useful information. Posts like "cool", "lol", "yeah" and "I agree" don't contain anything useful for others. We are not fans of off topic, unless it contains something smart or funny. Most of things spammers find funny are actually not funny at all.</li><br />
<li>Nothing to do with private servers belongs on moparisthebest.com, use http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/ for these things.</li><br />
<li>DO NOT post or upload any copyrighted materials, ie deobs, clients or any other sort.</li><br />

<b><u>Buying / Selling</u></b>
<li>We do not sell anything on this site with the exception of SCAR scripts.  SCAR Scripts must be verified, check the script sales board for more info.</li><br />

<b><u>Accounts</u></b>
<li>We only have one Forum account per person for Moparisthebest.com and Moparscape.org.  If you get banned, email an admin, or get a friend to contact an admin.  If you have trouble logging in, click 'forgot my password.'</li><br />

<b><u>Linking / Advertisement</u></b>
<li>We don't advertise other sites or communities unless we ask and receive permission to from a Gmod or Admin. We don't post links to sites that are not in safe sites list on Moparisthebest.com main page.</li><br />
<li>We never advertise via the PM system whether the site is approved or not.</li><br />
<li>We never have misleading links in our signatures or posts.  If a link says google.com, we expect it to take us to google.com.</li><br />
</ol> 
</tt>
</div>

<br /><br /><font color="white">Type <i>'yes'</i> if you agree to <i>ALL</i> of the above terms.<br />
You must have cookies enabled for this to work.</font> <br /><form method="post" action="/agreement.php?returnto=http://www.moparisthebest.com/index.php">  <input name="agree" size="20" /><br />
  <input type="submit" name="Submit" value="I Agree" />
  <input type="submit" name="Cancel" value="Cancel" />
</form></center>
</body>
</html>

Wont work because it doesnt have a form handler
Just think noobs…:
You cant l33ch Mopars Because its in a PHP file
if Mopar wanted u to leech then he would have put in a html file hmmm?
[/quote]

wat are you on about? he posted the php file above and it works fine

Read full topic
